_header: At the time of matins Lord Thou were I-take
_description: The Hours of the Cross — couplets arranged in one 6-line stanza and seven quatrains

NLS18721.First Lines:
[At] þe time of matines lord þu were itake[ ] of
                    þine disciples sone were for sake…
NLS18721.Last Lines:
…þat þu þat suffredest for me harde pininggebe
                    my solas & my comfort at my last endingge
NLS18721.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 69-70.
Davies,  Reginald Thorne. 
             Medieval English Lyrics: a critical anthology.
         London, 1963; Evanston, IL: Northwestern UP, 1964: 130-2.
Luria,  Maxwell Sidney,  and  Richard L. Hoffman, eds.  
             Middle English Lyrics.
         New York: Norton, 1974: 198-9.
